commitResults.messageTitle: feat: Rename chatbot and implement initial skeleton
feat: Add echo and exit functionality
feat: Store and list user commands
feat: Add task mark/unmark and refactor classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Chatbot does not support marking/unmarking tasks as done.

A marking functionality increases the effectiveness of the chatbot as a
personal assistant.

Let's,
* implement marking by introducing a Task class with relevant data.
* refactor the code by including Chatbot, TaskList, CommandParser, and
MessagePrinter classes as per single responsibility principle to
implement this and preceding functionalities in a clean, modular manner.

commitResults.messageTitle: style: Format code as per coding standard
feat: Add tracking support for different task types
refactor: Extract command evaluation logic into classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Chatbot class combines reading input, parsing, validation, task
handling and display. Additionally, the TaskList handles printing
logic. These violate SLAP.

Separating responsibilities makes the code object-oriented in nature
as opposed to procedural.

Let's,
* introduce Command class and its subclasses to handle command execution
* instantiate all dependencies in Chatbot class only
* introduce Task and Command types to restrict values they can take up
* remove cases of magic numbers and include constants where applicable
